intro: Piptatherum, commonly known as false brome, is a genus of grasses belonging to the family Poaceae. These plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Piptatherum species typically have slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. They produce small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Many species are considered invasive in certain regions due to their rapid growth and ability to outcompete native vegetation.
